name: Thai Roasted Duck Curry (Gaeng Phed Ped Yang)
description: Authentic Thai roasted duck curry recipe for gaeng phed ped yang with red curry paste, healthy vegetables, and fresh pineapple.

recipeInstructions.text: Start by heating a pot or large wok pan over medium heat. Add 200ml (about 6.80 fl oz) of coconut milk and let it simmer, stirring occasionally. Wait for the oil to start separating from the milk, which enriches the curry’s flavor and aroma.
recipeInstructions.name: Start by heating a pot or large wok pan over medium heat. Add 200ml (about 6.80 fl oz) of coconut milk and let it simmer, stirring occasionally. Wait for the oil to start separating from the milk, which enriches the curry’s flavor and aroma.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the red curry paste thoroughly until it’s well mixed. Then, gradually pour in the rest of the coconut milk, combining it well with the paste.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the red curry paste thoroughly until it’s well mixed. Then, gradually pour in the rest of the coconut milk, combining it well with the paste.

recipeInstructions.text: As the sauce begins to boil again, add the duck slices, palm sugar, and fish sauce. Stir until the palm sugar fully dissolves.
recipeInstructions.name: As the sauce begins to boil again, add the duck slices, palm sugar, and fish sauce. Stir until the palm sugar fully dissolves.

recipeInstructions.text: Next, add your vegetables and pineapple chunks into the curry. Let it simmer for 1–2 minutes, or until the tomatoes reach your desired softness.
recipeInstructions.name: Next, add your vegetables and pineapple chunks into the curry. Let it simmer for 1–2 minutes, or until the tomatoes reach your desired softness.

recipeInstructions.text: Finally, turn off the heat and gently mix in the basil leaves. Serve the curry hot and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Finally, turn off the heat and gently mix in the basil leaves. Serve the curry hot and enjoy!

review.reviewBody:
An awesome dish.
A couple of notes, gaeng phed means "curry hot" or "curry spicy".  "Red" is "daeng". 
I use oil and then add the paste. Then palm sugar. Then coconut milk or cream. Then everything else with pine apples almost last and also lychees. Finally, 30 seconds before serving (while still simmering, add Thai sweet basil leaves.
Aroi maak maak! ? (Very very yummy) ?

keywords: gaeng phed ped yang, red duck curry, roasted duck curry, thai duck curry
